gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.14/hr signals constrained supply amid aggressive capex expansion, with chip availability becoming the critical bottleneck as hyperscalers accelerate data center buildouts.

gtpi.text: Input pricing at $1.25/1M tokens reflects intense API price compression driven by model commoditization, pushing providers toward specialized efficiency optimizations rather than pure scale advantages.

gagl.text: Annual load reaching 120 TWh indicates grid infrastructure approaching capacity limits, necessitating accelerated nuclear adoption and renewable baseload solutions to sustain AI compute growth.

aipi.text: Convergent pressure from hardware costs, token price deflation, and energy intensity suggests the AI industry approaching a normalization phase where sustainable economics will determine market leaders from speculative players.
